The thrill of saving money with coupons and discounts! I'm happy to help you get organized and make the most out of your deals.

Congratulations on scoring that 20% off coupon at Target, by the way! That's a great start to your savings journey.

Here are some tips to help you keep track of your coupons and discounts:

1. **Designate a central hub**: Choose one spot where you'll store all your coupons, discounts, and offers. This could be a physical folder, binder, or a digital note-taking app like Evernote or OneNote.
2. **Categorize and prioritize**: Organize your coupons by category (e.g., groceries, retail, dining, entertainment) and prioritize them by expiration date. This will help you focus on using the ones that are about to expire first.
3. **Use a coupon aggregator**: Consider using a coupon aggregator app or website like RetailMeNot, Coupons.com, or Fetch Rewards, which can help you find and organize coupons, discounts, and cashback offers in one place.
4. **Set reminders**: Set reminders for coupon expiration dates or special deal days (e.g., Black Friday, Cyber Monday) to ensure you don't miss out on savings opportunities.
5. **Digitalize your coupons**: Take a photo of your physical coupons or save digital copies in a designated folder on your phone or computer. This way, you'll always have access to your coupons, even if you're not carrying the physical ones.
6. **Create a coupon calendar**: Plan your shopping trips and coupon usage around your coupon expiration dates. Mark the dates on your calendar and make a note of the coupons you plan to use.
7. **Stack your savings**: Look for opportunities to combine coupons with other discounts, cashback offers, or loyalty rewards to maximize your savings.
8. **Purge expired coupons**: Regularly go through your coupon collection and remove expired or invalid offers to avoid clutter and confusion.
9. **Keep your apps organized**: If you're using multiple apps for coupons and discounts, consider organizing them into folders on your phone or creating a separate home screen for your savings apps.
10. **Review and adjust**: Periodically review your coupon organization system to ensure it's working for you. Make adjustments as needed to stay organized and focused on your savings goals.

By implementing these tips, you'll be able to keep track of your coupons and discounts more efficiently, saving you time and money in the long run.
